story.text: CHICAGO Jan 3 General Motors Corp.'s (GM.N) average U.S. transaction price rose 8 percent in December on vehicles from the prior year, its chief sales analyst told reporters and analysts on Wednesday. Paul Ballew, GM's chief sales analyst said U.S. light vehicle sales ran at an annualized adjusted rate of 16.9 million units in December for the industry and light vehicle sales are estimated to have declined about 2.3 percent to roughly 16.7 million units for 2006. GM's U.S. retail sales rose 10 percent in December from November, Ballew added.
story.title: gm says average us transaction price up 8 pct in dec ,
